responses.content: We announced the $8B Informatica acquisition to unite the #1 AI CRM with the leading AI MDM/ETL platform because every AI transformation is a data transformation. We need to harmonize enterprise data, and Informatica accelerates that mission so agents can deliver trusted insights.

Q1 revenue $9.83B (+8% Y/Y), 32.3% non-GAAP margin, $6.5B operating cash flow, 60.9B RPO (+13%). We now have 4,000 paid Agentforce customers, 800 in production, 8,000 deals overall, and more than $1B in Data Cloud + Agentforce ARR. FlexCredits, FedRAMP High, and our ADAM (Agents, Data, Apps, Metadata) framework keep us ahead.

With ADAM live across Customer 360, Slack, and Tableau Next, we're scaling digital labor globally. We're reinvesting in sales distribution, especially SMB/mid-market, and building 1,000+ new reps while protecting margins and cash flow, to chase the multitrillion-dollar AI opportunity.

My CoFO priorities: deliver customer success and accelerate AI adoption, drive operational excellence, and allocate capital responsibly. We returned $3.1B in Q1 (share repurchases + dividend) and raised dividends 4% while keeping accretive M&A discipline.

More than half of Q1 top 100 deals included 6+ clouds, Tableau appeared in 70% of $1M+ deals, MuleSoft in nearly half, and partners played a critical role in 7 of the top 10 wins. The ADAM flywheel is lowering attrition as customers adopt Data Cloud and Agentforce.

The agentic layer must live on top of trusted data, so Data Cloud, MuleSoft, Tableau, and soon Informatica create the enterprise-grade metadata platform agents need. We created forward-deployed engineering teams, iterating daily with customers to accelerate consumption, observability, and trust.

We added capacity—14% growth in AEs, aiming for 22% by year-end—focused on SMB/mid-market where we saw surprising momentum. Pipeline velocity is double-digit, AWS Marketplace continues to triple YoY, and we're pushing every rep to sell Data Cloud and Agentforce to accelerate expansion.

questions: Which puts and takes should we watch for growth acceleration? You raised guidance to $41.3B—what's driving that, and how do you plan to maintain margin and cash flow while investing?
With macro uncertainty, tariffs, and FX, what are you seeing in pipeline behavior and headroom in demand?
How does Tableau and the impending Informatica deal change the platform story and accelerate agentic outcomes?
What leading indicators convince you that this agentic AI cycle is material—data adoption, pilots, consumption metrics?
What has surprised you on use cases, ROI, and geographic adoption of Agentforce plus Data Cloud this quarter?
What still holds back enterprise AI adoption compared to consumer; why do we need Informatica now, and when will the deal be accretive?
How can Salesforce help companies navigate AI-driven workforce changes while preserving human oversight?

metadata.source: Q1 2026 earnings call transcript & press release
